item.title: US House of Representatives Prevents Encryption Backdoor Blockade
item.description:
US House of Representatives Prevents Encryption Backdoor Blockade

A huge blow has been dealt to privacy advocates has been achieved in the US House of Representatives earlier today. After blocking an amendment that would prevent government officials from enforcing security backdoors and weakened encryption, it looks like privacy is not on the agenda for US politicians.

item.title: Virtual safe haven? Bitcoin surges to highest in more than two years
item.description:
Virtual safe haven? Bitcoin surges to highest in more than two years

LONDON, June 16 The price of bitcoin surged 8 percent to $750 on Thursday, its highest since early 2014, as jittery investors sought shelter in the web-based currency, once considered too volatile to invest in, let alone at times of market stress.

item.title: BTCS Stocks Fall to an All Time Low, Future Uncertain - NEWSBTC
item.description:
BTCS Stocks Fall to an All Time Low, Future Uncertain - NEWSBTC

BTCS, the Bitcoin company is seeing the price of its stocks plummet to an all time low. Read more... The stocks belonging to BTCS, the bitcoin company has been seeing a considerable amount of activity in the recent days.

item.title: Customers Sue Alleged Crypto Ponzi Scheme GAW Miners - CoinDesk
item.description:
Customers Sue Alleged Crypto Ponzi Scheme GAW Miners - CoinDesk

A civil lawsuit has been filed on behalf of the customers of the now-defunct cryptocurrency mining company GAW Miners, naming its CEO and a longtime investor as defendants. Filed in the US District Court in Connecticut, the suit names two firms, GAW Miners and ZenMiner, as well as CEO Homero Joshua Garza and investor Stuart Fraser, the latter of whom previously served as vice chairman of Wall Street investment bank Cantor Fitzgerald.

item.title: Bank of Canada Explores Blockchain Technology
item.description:
Bank of Canada Explores Blockchain Technology

The Bank of Canada said it is studying the technology that underlies the digital currency bitcoin, conducting one of the first known tests by a major central bank about how it could use the nascent system known as blockchain. The central bank confirmed the experiment dealing in interbank payments in a statement from senior deputy governor Carolyn Wilkins.

item.title: What is meant by value-based transactions in blockchain?
item.description:
What is meant by value-based transactions in blockchain?

Answer: Blockchain is a form of a distributed real-time database system. Each transaction should be assigned a "value" to represent its worthiness in the subjective system terms. The mentioned worthiness may differ from one blockchain type to another but in most cases it addresses the issue of sc...

item.title: Bitcoin Rise: will it continue in the future days? | HolyTransaction
item.description:
Bitcoin Rise: will it continue in the future days? | HolyTransaction

It is not a news that the Bitcoin rise very fast during the last few weeks, reaching a high of $735 today. But the real question everybody is asking is: will Bitcoin keep growing? After a two years high, on Wednesday the bitcoin price fell, but it was only temporary and now the price is rising again.

item.title: Brexit and Bitcoin and Gold...Oh My! - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Brexit and Bitcoin and Gold...Oh My! - Bitcoin News

Brexit is the abbreviation for "British exit," and it has come to mean two things: the UK's departure from the European Union; and the June 23rd "in or out" British referendum on leaving. How will the vote affect bitcoin and gold?

item.title: I believe the network will eventually have so many problems, that an increase in blocksize will happen. But 2MB is not enough, lets push for 8MB or 20MB instead * /r/btc
item.description:
I believe the network will eventually have so many problems, that an increase in blocksize will happen. But 2MB is not enough, lets push for 8MB or 20MB instead * /r/btc

Yes, let's eliminate the limit. Nothing bad will happen if we do. And if I'm wrong, the bad things would be mild annoyances, not existential...
